sections.title: Introduction — Local vs Cloud Unit Test Implementation
sections.summary: Explains that a local implementation of an AI-related unit test took a few minutes and proposes using a cloud-isolated agent to implement missing unit tests instead.
key_actions: Recognize existing local unit test implementation time
Propose delegating missing tests to a cloud agent

sections.title: Options to Trigger Automated Work (Issues vs Copilot)
sections.summary: Describes methods to have the cloud agent implement tests: create an issue identifying missing tests and activate GitHub Copilot to resolve it. Presenter prepares to enable GitHub tools.
key_actions: Create an issue describing missing unit tests
Activate/assign Copilot to solve the issue
Enable GitHub tools integration (MCP)

sections.title: Search for Existing Issues Related to Missing Tests
sections.summary: Runs a search (via the enabled GitHub tool) to see if any repository issues relate to missing unit tests and finds an open issue (#18). The tool requires permission to run.
key_actions: Allow execution of the GitHub search tool
Search repository issues for 'missing unit tests'
Identify issue #18

sections.title: Open and Inspect Issue #18
sections.summary: Opens issue #18 in the repository which requests 'add missing unit tests for products, store and domain entity'. Notes the issue contains scope, acceptance criteria, tasks, labels and other metadata.
key_actions: Open issue #18 in repository
Review scope, acceptance criteria and task list

sections.title: Assign Copilot to the Issue (via GitHub or Visual Studio)
sections.summary: Describes two ways to delegate the issue to Copilot: using the GitHub UI (preferred) or directly from Visual Studio. Demonstrates assigning Copilot to issue #18.
key_actions: Choose method (GitHub UI or Visual Studio) to assign Copilot
Execute 'assign copilot to issue #18'

sections.title: Copilot Creates a Pull Request and Works in Cloud
sections.summary: After assignment, Copilot creates a pull request and begins running isolated in the cloud. The PR session shows steps: creating environment, creating a fork, getting repository, and other automated setup operations.
key_actions: Refresh issue to see Copilot pickup
Open pull request created by Copilot
View session steps (environment creation, fork, repo checkout)

sections.title: Reviewing Completed PRs and New Test Files
sections.summary: Shows an already-completed PR (#17) as an example. Reviews changed files, sees new unit tests added for products and store, and notes the session runtime (~18 minutes) and the logged steps (plan, view source, etc.).
key_actions: Open file changes in the PR
Examine added test files (products tests, store tests, frontend tests)
Review the session log and duration (approx. 18 minutes)

sections.title: CI Execution: GitHub Actions and Logs
sections.summary: Points out the PR is running CI via a GitHub Action. Demonstrates opening the action run and viewing a full log of what happened during the automated process.
key_actions: Open GitHub Actions run for the PR
Inspect the action logs to trace steps and results

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot to implement missing unit tests
Issue-based automation workflow (create issue → assign Copilot → PR)
Repository and PR review (files changed, new tests)
Cloud-isolated agent sessions and automation steps
CI integration with GitHub Actions and logs
video: brk447-07-Implement unit tests using GH Issue.mp4
